title: SLASH'EM
data:
***SLASH'EM*** (**Super Lotsa Added Stuff Hack - Extended Magic**) is a [variant](/wiki/Variant "Variant") of *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* based on version [3.4.3](/wiki/3.4.3 "3.4.3"). The object of the game is the same: to fetch the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") from the bottom of the [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") and offer it to your [god](/wiki/God "God").

*SLASH'EM* contains five [new roles](/wiki/Category:SLASH%27EM_roles "Category:SLASH'EM roles") and five [new races](/wiki/Category:SLASH%27EM_races "Category:SLASH'EM races") for the player to choose from, as well as several [new special levels](/wiki/Special_level_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Special level (SLASH'EM)"), [monsters](/wiki/Monster_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Monster (SLASH'EM)"), [items](/wiki/Item_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Item (SLASH'EM)"), and [artifacts](/index.php?title=Category:SLASH%27EM_Artifacts\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Category:SLASH'EM Artifacts (page does not exist)"). The main [dungeon](/wiki/Dungeon "Dungeon") is made longer in *SLASH'EM* than in *NetHack*, with Gehennom being shorter as a result.

*SLASH'EM* is considered much more difficult than vanilla *NetHack*, primarily due to the perception of the new content as unbalancing the game. Many of the more popular additions to SLASH'EM have been incorporated into actively developed variants, such as the [Vampire](/wiki/Vampire_\(starting_race_in_UnNetHack\) "Vampire (starting race in UnNetHack)") starting race and the [Black Market](/wiki/Black_market_\(UnNetHack\) "Black market (UnNetHack)") level in [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"). There is also a successor named [Slash'EM Extended](/wiki/Slash%27EM_Extended "Slash'EM Extended"), which also has a variant/second 'successor' named [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Creation](#Creation)
  - [1.1 Ancestors and successors](#Ancestors_and_successors)
- [2 Public servers](#Public_servers)
- [3 Builds](#Builds)
- [4 See also](#See_also)
- [5 External links](#External_links)

## Creation

SLASH'EM is the result of [Warren Cheung](/index.php?title=Warren_Cheung\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Warren Cheung (page does not exist)") merging the popular [Wizard Patch](/wiki/Wizard_Patch "Wizard Patch") into SLASH, calling the resulting game SLASH'EM, and released it on [7 January 1998](https://groups.google.com/group/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/msg/21fc87c895373907). SLASH and SLASH'EM co-existed alongside each other until the release of [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0"), accepted the Wizard Patch into the mainline code - SLASH'EM 0.0.5E8 merged in the 3.3.0 code, and so SLASH ceased to exist as a separate game.

### Ancestors and successors

|                                                      |                                                     |                                |                                                                                                 |                                                                                |                                                                                                 |                                                                              |
| ---------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [NetHack 3.2](/wiki/NetHack_3.2.0 "NetHack 3.2.0") → | [NetHack--](/wiki/NetHack-- "NetHack--") →          | [SLASH](/wiki/SLASH "SLASH") → | [Slash'EM](/wiki/Slash%27EM "Slash'EM") →                                                       | [Slash'EM Extended](/wiki/Slash%27EM_Extended "Slash'EM Extended") 0.01–0.75 → |                                                                                                 | [Slash'EM Extended](/wiki/Slash%27EM_Extended "Slash'EM Extended") 0.76–2.60 |
|                                                      | [NetHack Plus](/wiki/NetHack_Plus "NetHack Plus") → |                                |                                                                                                 |                                                                                |                                                                                                 |                                                                              |
|                                                      | [Wizard Patch](/wiki/Wizard_Patch "Wizard Patch") → |                                | [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM")                                                        |                                                                                |                                                                                                 |                                                                              |
|                                                      |                                                     |                                | [NetHack 3.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0")–[3.4](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") → |                                                                                | [NetHack 3.6](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0")–[3.6.4](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.4 "NetHack 3.6.4") |                                                                              |

## Public servers

*SLASH'EM* is hosted online at [Hardfought](/wiki/Hardfought "Hardfought"), which adds an enhanced xlogfile and dumplogs. It is also hosted at [em.slashem.me](/wiki/Em.slashem.me "Em.slashem.me"), which is not available as of April 2021.

## Builds

*SLASH'EM* is available for Windows, MS-DOS, Linux, OS/2, (obsolete) Mac classic and Mac OS X (tty only); the latest stable version of *SLASH'EM* is 0.0.7E7F3 and the latest development version is 0.0.8E0F1. As of September 16th, 2018, there are active forks of *SLASH'EM* being maintained; changes consist mainly of bug fixes and quality-of-life improvements. K2's version (with fixes contributed by amateurhour) can be found [here](https://github.com/k21971/SlashEM/commits/master); Elronnd's is [here](https://github.com/moon-chilled/slashem9).

In addition, SLASH'EM is available as an [Android app](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_Android_app "SLASH'EM Android app").

## See also

- [Monster (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Monster_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Monster (SLASH'EM)")
- [Item (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Item_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Item (SLASH'EM)")
- [SLASH'EM artifacts](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_artifacts "SLASH'EM artifacts")
- [Standard strategy (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Standard_strategy_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Standard strategy (SLASH'EM)")
- [SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2 source code](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2_source_code "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2 source code")

## External links

- [The SLASH'EM Homepage](http://www.slashem.org/)
- [Differences Between Slash'EM And NetHack](https://sites.google.com/view/evasroguelikegamessite/differences-between-slashem-and-nethack), a collection of SLASH'EM spoilers
- [Ye Olde SlashEm Bestiary](http://slashem.crash-override.net/bestiary/)
- [Jym's Slash'em 0.0.7E7F1 patch(es)](http://bamgames.free.fr/Slashem/), a huge collection of patches, including ports of NetHack and older SLASH'EM patches
- [Codex Gamicus article for SLASH'EM](https://gamicus.fandom.com/wiki/SLASH%27EM)
- [SLASH'EM for iPhone](http://blog.dirkz.com/2010/06/slashem-10-released-for-iphone.html)
- [SLASH'EM for Android](http://market.android.com/details?id=com.slashemff)
- [SLASH'EM for MacOSX](https://code.google.com/p/slashem-macosx/)
- [RGRN announcement of SLASH'EM 0.0.1](https://groups.google.com/d/msg/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/y4VIfZmzi2I/3If3z3u0F4UJ) (not yet named SLASH'EM)
- [RGRN announcement of SLASH'EM 0.0.2E8](https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!msg/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/G-ZRDEWuYGs/Bzk3lciH_CEJ) (first mentioning of the name SLASH'EM)

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")
html:
SLASH'EM

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

SLASH'EM (Super Lotsa Added Stuff Hack - Extended Magic) is a variant of NetHack based on version 3.4.3. The object of the game is the same: to fetch the Amulet of Yendor from the bottom of the Gehennom and offer it to your god.

SLASH'EM contains five new roles and five new races for the player to choose from, as well as several new special levels, monsters, items, and artifacts. The main dungeon is made longer in SLASH'EM than in NetHack, with Gehennom being shorter as a result.

SLASH'EM is considered much more difficult than vanilla NetHack, primarily due to the perception of the new content as unbalancing the game. Many of the more popular additions to SLASH'EM have been incorporated into actively developed variants, such as the Vampire starting race and the Black Market level in UnNetHack. There is also a successor named Slash'EM Extended, which also has a variant/second 'successor' named SlashTHEM.

Contents

  • 1 Creation
    • 1.1 Ancestors and successors
  • 2 Public servers
  • 3 Builds
  • 4 See also
  • 5 External links

Creation

SLASH'EM is the result of Warren Cheung merging the popular Wizard Patch into SLASH, calling the resulting game SLASH'EM, and released it on 7 January 1998. SLASH and SLASH'EM co-existed alongside each other until the release of NetHack 3.3.0, accepted the Wizard Patch into the mainline code - SLASH'EM 0.0.5E8 merged in the 3.3.0 code, and so SLASH ceased to exist as a separate game.

Ancestors and successors

NetHack 3.2 → NetHack-- → SLASH → Slash'EM → Slash'EM Extended
0.01–0.75 → 		Slash'EM Extended
0.76–2.60
NetHack Plus →
Wizard Patch → SlashTHEM
NetHack 3.3–3.4 → NetHack 3.6–3.6.4

Public servers

SLASH'EM is hosted online at Hardfought, which adds an enhanced xlogfile and dumplogs. It is also hosted at em.slashem.me, which is not available as of April 2021.

Builds

SLASH'EM is available for Windows, MS-DOS, Linux, OS/2, (obsolete) Mac classic and Mac OS X (tty only); the latest stable version of SLASH'EM is 0.0.7E7F3 and the latest development version is 0.0.8E0F1. As of September 16th, 2018, there are active forks of SLASH'EM being maintained; changes consist mainly of bug fixes and quality-of-life improvements. K2's version (with fixes contributed by amateurhour) can be found here; Elronnd's is here.

In addition, SLASH'EM is available as an Android app.

See also

  • Monster (SLASH'EM)
  • Item (SLASH'EM)
  • SLASH'EM artifacts
  • Standard strategy (SLASH'EM)
  • SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2 source code

External links

  • The SLASH'EM Homepage
  • Differences Between Slash'EM And NetHack, a collection of SLASH'EM spoilers
  • Ye Olde SlashEm Bestiary
  • Jym's Slash'em 0.0.7E7F1 patch(es), a huge collection of patches, including ports of NetHack and older SLASH'EM patches
  • Codex Gamicus article for SLASH'EM
  • SLASH'EM for iPhone
  • SLASH'EM for Android
  • SLASH'EM for MacOSX
  • RGRN announcement of SLASH'EM 0.0.1 (not yet named SLASH'EM)
  • RGRN announcement of SLASH'EM 0.0.2E8 (first mentioning of the name SLASH'EM)
